Oxidative Phosphorylation: Produces NADP+ and ADP, but I don't know if it makes sugar.

Beta oxidation: Breaks down lipids into fatty acids, which then go through the Krebs cycle. No sugar here.
Chemiosmosis: Electron transport complexes, so not directly making sugar.
Light-dependent reactions: Produce ATP, NADPH, but not sugar.
Pyruvate oxidation: Leads to acetyl-CoA, generates some energy, but not sugar.
Fermentation: Converts alcohol to acetaldehyde, uses lactate, but no sugar.
Calvin cycle: Makes sugars from CO2 and water, yes.
Anaerobic respiration (Krebs): Uses NADH and FADH2 to break down glucose into CO2 and H2O, releasing ATP.
